title: Two Pointers & Sliding Window
concept: This level focuses on the two-pointer technique (mainly on arrays and strings) and sliding window (fixed and variable size) to solve problems in O(N) or O(N log N) instead of O(N^2).

challenges.title: Pair with Given Sum (Sorted Array)
challenges.description: Given a sorted array and a target X, check if there exists a pair (i, j) such that arr[i] + arr[j] = X. Use two-pointer technique from both ends.
challenges.inputDescription: First line N, second line N sorted integers, third line X.
challenges.outputDescription: Print Yes if such a pair exists, otherwise No.
challenges.starterCode: // use two pointers i=0, j=n-1 and move based on sum

challenges.title: Count Pairs with Given Sum (Sorted Array)
challenges.description: Given a sorted array and X, count how many pairs (i, j) with i < j have arr[i] + arr[j] = X. Use two pointers.
challenges.inputDescription: N, array of N sorted integers, and X.
challenges.outputDescription: Print the number of such pairs.
challenges.starterCode: // two pointers from both ends, handle duplicates carefully

challenges.title: Move Zeros to End
challenges.description: Given an array, move all zeros to the end while maintaining relative order of non-zero elements. Use two-pointer technique and O(1) extra space.
challenges.starterCode: // use index 'pos' to place next non-zero, then fill rest with 0

challenges.title: Reverse Array Using Two Pointers
challenges.description: Reverse the entire array in-place using two indices: start and end.
challenges.starterCode: // i=0, j=n-1; swap arr[i], arr[j] and move i++, j--

challenges.title: Palindrome String Check (Two Pointers)
challenges.description: Given a string (no spaces), check if it is a palindrome using two indices (left and right).
challenges.outputDescription: Print Yes if palindrome, else No.
challenges.starterCode: // left=0, right=len-1; compare characters while left<right

challenges.title: Max Sum Subarray of Size K (Sliding Window)
challenges.description: Given an array of N integers and an integer K, find the maximum sum of any contiguous subarray of size K. Use fixed-size sliding window.
challenges.starterCode: // maintain current window sum of size K while sliding

challenges.title: Smallest Subarray with Sum ≥ K (Positive Numbers)
challenges.description: Given an array of N positive integers and a value K, find the length of the smallest contiguous subarray whose sum is at least K. If no such subarray exists, print 0. Use variable-size sliding window.
challenges.inputDescription: N, K, and N positive integers.
challenges.outputDescription: Print the minimum length, or 0 if not possible.
challenges.starterCode: // expand right to increase sum, shrink left while sum>=K

challenges.title: Longest Subarray with Sum ≤ K (Positive Numbers)
challenges.description: Given an array of N positive integers and K, find the length of the longest contiguous subarray with sum ≤ K using sliding window.
challenges.inputDescription: N, K, and N positive integers.

challenges.title: Longest Substring with At Most K Distinct Characters
challenges.description: Given a string S and integer K, find the length of the longest substring that contains at most K distinct characters. Use sliding window with frequency map.
challenges.inputDescription: String S on first line, integer K on second line.
challenges.starterCode: // maintain window [l,r], map<char,count>, while distinct>K shrink from left

challenges.title: Count Subarrays with Sum Exactly K (Positive Numbers)
challenges.description: Given an array of N positive integers and K, count how many contiguous subarrays have sum exactly K. Use two pointers / sliding window (because all numbers are positive).
challenges.inputDescription: N, K, and N positive integers.
examples:
Input:
5 5
1 2 1 2 1
Output:
4  (subarrays: [1,2,1], [2,1,2? no], check carefully: [2,1,2]=5, [1,2,1] at positions, etc.)
challenges.starterCode: // move right to increase sum, move left to decrease when sum>K, count when sum==K
